sourcesContent:
import React, { useState } from 'react'; import { CheckCircle, Circle, Play, Clock, Calendar, BookOpen, Code, Target, Award, Users } from 'lucide-react'; const Tasks = () => { const [enabledTasks, setEnabledTasks] = useState([]); const [completedTasks, setCompletedTasks] = useState([]); const tasks = [ { id: 1, title: "Task 1: HTML Basics", description: "Learn HTML fundamentals and create your first webpage", duration: "2 hours", difficulty: "Beginner", category: "Web Development", requirements: [ "Complete HTML tutorial", "Create a simple webpage", "Submit assignment" ], instructions: ` # Task 1: HTML Basics ## Objective Create a simple webpage using HTML to demonstrate your understanding of basic HTML elements. ## Requirements 1. Create an HTML file with proper structure 2. Include at least 3 different heading levels (h1, h2, h3) 3. Add paragraphs with some text content 4. Include an ordered list and an unordered list 5. Add at least 2 images (you can use placeholder images) 6. Create a simple form with name and email fields 7. Add a table with at least 3 rows and 3 columns ## Submission - Save your file as "task1.html" - Test your webpage in a browser - Submit the file through the assignment portal ## Evaluation Criteria - Proper HTML structure - Correct use of HTML tags - Clean and readable code - All requirements met `, dueDate: "2024-02-15", points: 100 }, { id: 2, title: "Task 2: CSS Styling", description: "Style your HTML webpage with CSS", duration: "3 hours", difficulty: "Beginner", category: "Web Development", requirements: [ "Learn CSS basics", "Style your HTML page", "Make it responsive" ], instructions: ` # Task 2: CSS Styling ## Objective Style your HTML webpage from Task 1 using CSS to make it visually appealing. ## Requirements 1. Create a separate CSS file 2. Apply consistent color scheme 3. Style headings with different fonts and colors 4. Add hover effects to links 5. Style your form elements 6. Make the page responsive (mobile-friendly) 7. Add some animations or transitions ## CSS Concepts to Use - Selectors (element, class, ID) - Box model (margin, padding, border) - Flexbox or Grid for layout - Media queries for responsiveness - Pseudo-classes (:hover, :focus) ## Submission - Create "styles.css" file - Link CSS to your HTML file - Test on different screen sizes - Submit both HTML and CSS files ## Evaluation Criteria - Clean and organized CSS - Responsive design - Consistent styling - Good user experience `, dueDate: "2024-02-20", points: 150 }, { id: 3, title: "Task 3: JavaScript Fundamentals", description: "Add interactivity to your webpage with JavaScript", duration: "4 hours", difficulty: "Intermediate", category: "Web Development", requirements: [ "Learn JavaScript basics", "Add interactive features", "Handle form submission" ], instructions: ` # Task 3: JavaScript Fundamentals ## Objective Add JavaScript functionality to your webpage to make it interactive. ## Requirements 1. Create a separate JavaScript file 2. Add form validation 3. Create a simple calculator 4. Add a dark/light mode toggle 5. Implement a simple quiz 6. Add smooth scrolling navigation 7. Create a countdown timer ## JavaScript Concepts to Use - Variables and data types - Functions and event handlers - DOM manipulation - Form handling - Local storage - Conditional statements - Loops ## Submission - Create "script.js" file - Link JavaScript to your HTML file - Test all functionality - Submit all files (HTML, CSS, JS) ## Evaluation Criteria - Working JavaScript functionality - Clean and readable code - Error handling - User-friendly interactions `, dueDate: "2024-02-25", points: 200 }, { id: 4, title: "Task 4: React Components", description: "Build a React application with components", duration: "6 hours", difficulty: "Intermediate", category: "Web Development", requirements: [ "Set up React project", "Create functional components", "Use props and state" ], instructions: ` # Task 4: React Components ## Objective Create a React application demonstrating component-based architecture. ## Requirements 1. Set up a new React project using Create React App 2. Create at least 5 functional components 3. Use props to pass data between components 4. Implement state management with useState 5. Create a simple todo list application 6. Add form handling with controlled components 7. Implement conditional rendering ## React Concepts to Use - Functional components - Props and prop drilling - useState hook - Event handling - Conditional rendering - List rendering with keys - Component composition ## Submission - Complete React application - All components working properly - Clean and organized code structure - Deploy to GitHub Pages or similar ## Evaluation Criteria - Proper React implementation - Component reusability - Clean code structure - Working functionality `, dueDate: "2024-03-01", points: 250 }, { id: 5, title: "Task 5: API Integration", description: "Connect your React app to external APIs", duration: "5 hours", difficulty: "Advanced", category: "Web Development", requirements: [ "Learn API concepts", "Fetch data from APIs", "Handle loading states" ], instructions: ` # Task 5: API Integration ## Objective Integrate external APIs into your React application. ## Requirements 1. Choose a public API (e.g., JSONPlaceholder, OpenWeatherMap) 2. Use fetch or axios to make API calls 3. Implement loading states 4. Handle API errors gracefully 5. Display fetched data in your components 6. Add search or filter functionality 7. Implement pagination if applicable ## API Integration Concepts - HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) - Async/await or promises - Error handling - Loading states - Data transformation - CORS and API keys ## Submission - Working API integration - Error handling implementation - Loading states - Clean user interface - Documentation of API used ## Evaluation Criteria - Successful API integration - Proper error handling - Good user experience - Clean code implementation `, dueDate: "2024-03-05", points: 300 } ]; const toggleTask = (taskId) => { if (enabledTasks.includes(taskId)) { setEnabledTasks(enabledTasks.filter(id => id !== taskId)); } else { setEnabledTasks([...enabledTasks, taskId]); } }; const completeTask = (taskId) => { if (!completedTasks.includes(taskId)) { setCompletedTasks([...completedTasks, taskId]); } }; const getDifficultyColor = (difficulty) => { switch (difficulty) { case 'Beginner': return 'bg-green-100 text-green-800'; case 'Intermediate': return 'bg-yellow-100 text-yellow-800'; case 'Advanced': return 'bg-red-100 text-red-800'; default: return 'bg-gray-100 text-gray-800'; } }; const getCategoryIcon = (category) => { switch (category) { case 'Web Development': return ; case 'Programming': return ; case 'AI/ML': return ; case 'Digital Marketing': return ; default: return ; } }; return (
{/* Header */}

Course Tasks

Complete tasks to progress through your course. Click on tasks to enable them, then work through the requirements to earn points.

{/* Progress Summary */}
{tasks.length}
Total Tasks
{enabledTasks.length}
Enabled
{completedTasks.length}
Completed
{completedTasks.reduce((total, taskId) => { const task = tasks.find(t => t.id === taskId); return total + (task ? task.points : 0); }, 0)}
Points Earned
{/* Tasks Grid */}
{tasks.map((task) => { const isEnabled = enabledTasks.includes(task.id); const isCompleted = completedTasks.includes(task.id); return (
{/* Task Header */}

{task.title}

{task.difficulty} {task.category}
{task.points}
points
{/* Task Description */}

{task.description}

{/* Task Details */}
{task.duration}
Due: {new Date(task.dueDate).toLocaleDateString()}
{/* Requirements */} {isEnabled && (

Requirements:

    {task.requirements.map((req, index) => (
  • {req}
    • ))}
)} {/* Action Buttons */}
{isEnabled && !isCompleted && ( )} {isEnabled && ( )}
{/* Status */}
Status: {isCompleted ? 'Completed' : isEnabled ? 'Enabled' : 'Disabled'} {isCompleted && ( ✓ Completed )}
); })}
{/* Instructions */}

How to Use Tasks

1. Enable Tasks: Click the circle icon next to any task to enable it
2. Start Working: Click "Start Task" to begin working on the requirements
3. Mark Complete: Click "Mark Complete" when you finish the task
); }; export default Tasks;
